title: Listening to Jatt repeatedly pronounce "udyr" is cringeworthy
body:
Its "oo-deer" not "oo-dur"

every time he says oo-dur a little part of me dies

replies.body: Just like how Deficio always pronounces {{item:3004}} Mana-moo-nay as Mana-myoon
I absolutely also pronounce it Mana-myoon, I think that's correct!
its based on a famous asian sword. saying manamune like mana-myoon is like calling excalibur ek-saa-laad-bahr

Oh I didn't know that! Thanks! I'm gonna pronounce it right then. 

http://cdn.theatlantic.com/assets/media/img/mt/2014/09/The_More_You_Know/lead_large.png

"Egg-salad-bar" lol. I don't know where that D came from.

No but seriously, by standard English pronunciation rules, it would be mana-myoon.

So we might as well start pronouncing island is-land right? Standard English pronunciation rules after all.. ;)

Point being that word origin is actually extremely important in English because our language is an amalgamation of various other languages with different pronunciations :)

Yes, word of origin is extremely important, in standard English. But this is a video game. Simply put, the word isn't used often enough to warrant even caring about pronunciation.

But if you wanna care about it, I recommend that you don't, considering that it's completely common and understandable for people to pronounce words by rules of their native language.
it does not follow English conventions. its not English to begin with.
It's important to remember that not everyone knows (or cares) about romanticized Japanese weaponry and mythology like Masamune and Muramasa, I think is what he means pretty much.

Ex-Salad bar

Used to serve salad, but now it's for desserts and whatnot

> [{quoted}](name=macromite,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=BPnWrWq0,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-02-22T02:19:32.803+0000)
>
> its based on a famous asian sword. saying manamune like mana-myoon is like calling excalibur ek-saa-laad-bahr

TIL
Because english rules say it is pronounced like that?

> [{quoted}](name=Cerbearus,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=BPnWrWq0,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2016-02-22T02:26:32.631+0000)
>
> Because english rules say it is pronounced like that?

Manamune and Muramana are named after the Japanese swordsmiths Masamune and Muramasa. It shouldn't follow English rules.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masamune

Now I want to know how you pronounce Freljord.

fray-l-yord
I love messing with people and saying frej - ord. Makes sense because its cold and that kind of sounds like frigid.
fel-yourd
Fridge - lord?

But, it's pronounced mana-moo-nay.
It's japanese themed, so that's why

> [{quoted}](name=FoggyPaws,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=BPnWrWq0,comment-id=00000007,timestamp=2016-02-22T22:09:47.142+0000)
>
> But, it's pronounced mana-moo-nay.
> It's japanese themed, so that's why

uhhh yes... i know thats why i said it :o
lol I'm so ass backwards didn't read properly haha
I've never been able to remember its name. I tend to call it Manamura or Mana-stick.
I pronounce it Mana-myoon, pretty sure thats how you say it O.O I could be wrong tho

> [{quoted}](name=Kotex,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=BPnWrWq0,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-02-22T01:08:39.986+0000)
>
> Just like how Deficio always pronounces {{item:3004}} Mana-moo-nay as Mana-myoon

I always thought it was mana-Moon.
It's actually manu-maan-nay, tbh.
Ugh. That pronunciation makes me want to cry inside.
It's "Ho-dor"
This led me to search Udyr up on Google. Turns out that Udyr is the Norwegian word for "beast". And it is in fact pronounced Oo-deer or in some pronunciations oo-dyeer
I am Norwegian and I can confirm this, that is probably as close as you'll get without phonetic spelling.

> [{quoted}](name=Svartfisk,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=BPnWrWq0,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2016-02-22T14:05:06.118+0000)
>
> I am Norwegian and I can confirm this, that is probably as close as you'll get without phonetic spelling.

What's the phonetic spelling?

I am no master of the phonetic alphabet (I looked it up, and realized how little I know), but my best guess would be something as straightforward as "u:dyr"; I have found the phonetic alphabet's characters are very similar in pronunciation to their visually corresponding characters in Norwegian. As I said, no master, so this comment tastes best with a pinch of salt.
Looking at you criticizing pronunciations for a noun that doesn't even have any defined, let alone required, pronunciation is cringeworthy.
Actually it does. Its the Norwegian word for monster. It's literal translation is "not animal"/"not beast"

> [{quoted}](name=PTT Void Terror,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=BPnWrWq0,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2016-02-22T13:59:07.045+0000)
>
> Actually it does. Its the Norwegian word for monster. It's literal translation is "not animal"/"not beast"

Good point.
There's only one solution to this predicament, and although it might seem extreme, it's for the best, for the very future of esports as a whole: We have to ban Udyr from the LCS.
Maybe he should ask some Udyr caster to help him.
"John-a".... {{champion:40}}
oo-dur.

I'm a fan of Poo-deer for pronunciation
But I know it's oo-dyr
Well how long have you been playing {{champion:77}} . Because Jatt has probably played it longer. Maybe he is right.
i say ooo-dee-yerr i feel like im 1 of few to deos 3 sillibles
Why not just change udyr's name to either trick2g or godyr. He'll we should just defer all udyr questions to trick

google translate pronounces it You-dear

thats even a new one for me, lol
Funny cuz Jatt was famous for his udyr way back in the day.
oooo durrr
I'm an Udyr main, and I say "YooDeer". Does that make me a bad person? :P
Actually in the proper Norwegian pronunciation it'd pronounced more like o-dea
